comment: It's a decent class, but I ended up withdrawing from it. I wouldn't recommend it if you struggle with math, because the class is strictly based on Aleks, and the videos aren't helpful since they don't explain the material well. You have to take the final in person, so it's just not worth the stress.

This teacher was a good teacher with aleks and he opened assignments back up when I explained what happened after missing one of the leks course. All around great teacher and students would be lucky to have him next year.

He is a really nice professor and he replies fast to emails. Although he gives homework, He extends the due date which is really good. His tests are also based on the study guides he gives, so be sure to do the study guide before taking the test. But other than that, He is a good option.. Take Him!!!!

Overall, the class was pretty easy. Everything you do is through Aleks. Study guides prepare you well for tests. Ensure you have enough time for all the homework, there's a lot. He does extend assignments and offers extra credit on the final. My biggest qualm was during the last week he assigned over 130 videos that all had to be watched for credit

he was really good, all of the tests were almost exactly the same as pre tests so if you took them alot you could get a 100 on the real one. he is a bit awkward but its adorable and like so easy class
Everything was on Aleks (which is a pain on its own) but the Professor was nice and gave extra credit for the final exam.

Professor has weekly help sessions, and is responsive outside of class. But you will be doing 100% of the coursework alone. The Aleks math platform is tedious and time consuming, especially if you get one question wrong you have to start over in the unit, which can take hours to finish a single hw assignment. Exams are lockdown with webcam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: He was very uninvolved. He isn't there to help you, just monitor the course. So if you can't teach yourself then this course isn't for you. All homework and tests are in ALEKS. The grade is made up of 4 tests, a final, and weekly homework. Tests are 70% of your grade and are all lockdown with a webcam.

Great professor. Explains material well and goes just the right pace. I never had to use him outside of class because I was never confused. Let's you use your laptop for the tests outside of the final. Highly recommend.

he is a very chill and simple prof. he reads the lecture slides, goes over homework in class, and also is available during his office hours to retake a test if you communicate about it. the units are not hard, just different areas of math thrown into one curriculum. just complete the aleks homework and review the lecture slides & you'll be good

I had Professor Goncharenko for my freshman college algebra class. Very patient and thorough in explanations, so rarely are you ever confused about something. Overall, he makes math very accessible. Really enjoyed his lectures and would take again.

I liked this professor. He was easy to reach, explained problems thoroughly and stopped if you didn't understand the work, and is very chill. The work is either on mml or aleks but math is just time-consuming in general. He's understanding of that. You should definitely consider taking him.
Kind and funny person

excellent math prof! the material was very easy, and he always explained it in an easy-to-understand way. Always open to questions and willing to explain and re-explain as needed. not a lot of work, everything is in MyLabMath, and I got 100s on all the tests. definitely take him if you can

Really chill dude. Explains concepts really well. Do the homework every week (on ALEKS), you should be good. Practice tests are exactly like the real ones. Only issue I have with him is he moves a little fast. He is usually 1-2 classes ahead of schedule, so you can be on HW 8, which isn't due yet, while he's teaching the stuff for homework 10 .

Very lenient on tests, great at explaining info and giving trick son easier ways to do things. Very nonchalant. Super easy teacher for this class only had tests and Aleks assignments, open to moving back deadline dates for homework.

She is a great professor. Very considerate and responds back quick if you have any issues. Majority of the work is on Aleks, including the 4 exams + Finals which are on Lockdown browser. If you do the homework and practice tests, you'll do well in this class.

3 tests and final that can replace lowest test score. The whole course is on Aleks and powerpoints are all found in d2l. He really cares about his students & is really great at explaining problems if you have questions. Also, he gives out extra credit and is accessible outside of class, responds fast to emails and accommodates you, super sweet man.

There is a lot of homework for the class, & attendance isn't mandatory it is highly recommended. His study guides are exactly like the test, if you study and show up to class you will be fine. He also drops your lowest homework grade  & he will replace your lowest test grade with whatever you make on the final.I recommend him for any math course

There is a lot of homework for the class, and while attendance isn't mandatory it is highly recommended. His homework system makes sure that you understand the material before moving on to the next topic. He always plans his lectures to have at least 2 days of in-class review before any test. Provided any formula we needed during tests.
Was very kind during class. Always made sure you knew the material. Great conversations after class. Really understands his stuff

I took this class last semester in 2021. Super chill dude and pretty easy class. Easiest   A i've ever got in math. I attended nearly every class although some people skipped a lot. The online homework was easy and really helped with the tests which are in person. Tests were easy too as long as you understand the material.
Had him last semester. Was a really cool guy and he does know his stuff. Great at lectures, and reaching out to students.

Math is already an easy A for me, so I never really payed attention or really went to class, but whenever I did I could tell he actually cared about teaching. Whenever someone had a question, he was always happy to answer it, and he always gave as many examples as possible so that everyone would understand the work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Mr G is kind of a dorky lil dude but a good professor. He takes attendance but I don't think it counts because I barely showed up. All the homework is online and tests are taken in person.

ngl i didnt go to his class often maybe like once or twice out of the month. i left the class with an average A. however if you want higher i do advise attending the class more often the. i did. for certain materials, youtube wasnt enough lol.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: A great professor if you are taking a gen ed math class. He lectures for an hour about problems directly on the homework website. Test questions are taken almost exactly from the review test on web assign so you can get a good idea of how well you will do on a test and easily practice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Good at explaining the material, lets you use a calculator on the tests. 3 tests (not including the final) and aleks hw but he usually extends them till Sunday night.

Professor is great! He is always an email away if you need anything. There are weekly homeworks on Alecks, but 95% of the time he extends the due date. He does take attendance, but if you cant be there for any reason he is lenient. If you take notes and do the study guides youll be just fine.
